Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, which has flaked away in places, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.160-1)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36358) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36358)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 211 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
